answers.answer: What kinds of foods should we really avoid during pregnancy? Also what kind of cheese should we stay away from if any? Thanks.

I am type 2 diabetes before even got pregnant. My a1c is 6.5. I have hard time to decide what to eat for dinner now I  order to not spike my number. Plus I am worry about the baby since it's will be the final destination or what I eat.
My iron is little low and i dont wana take the tablets, what kind of foods are very rich in iron?
I'm curious as to what foods we should stay away from as well???

ok thanks... I'm 17 weeks and have only been losing weight..11 pounds down now. I had an idea to eat avocados, coconut oil, and nuts to gain weight. What do you think?...btw, my intake is mostly fruit, some veggies, chicken, rice, potatos, corn for carbs since I have gluten intolerance..and I eat candy and fast-food quite a lot. I am on zofran btw.

Sorry to late replies ladies, but always stay away from raw fish, sword fish and even tuna. They can potientally hurt your baby! 12oz a week of salmon, shrimp or tilapia is ok. There's no limits to cheese. The calcium is good for you. And most of all stay away from LIVER the vitamin A can kill your baby brain!
It is best to consult your ob about your diabetes, but always remember to stick to a healthy diet. Stay away from high sugars please!
There have been birth defects from taking zofran, koyama83. And I heard that any dairy products need to be pasteurized. :)

Beets, beans, and all the dark greens! Be sure to drink plenty of orange juice too avoid constipation, oatmeal can help too, one cereal I found really rich in iron is the Krave cereal,  any kind is good.
I took zofran with my first born and he was born fine, the media is over doing it. If your ob feels its safe they can perscribe it, if not they will provide a alternative.

There's a chance of birth defects from any medication. If you have to take zofran to make due, then IMO, do what you've gotta do! I received criticism from a few about taking phenergan, but had horrible nausea up until about 22 weeks. I couldn't make it through most days without it & my job is what provides my family with food, shelter, & insurance. There are many out there that have/are taking zofran, etc & have had no birth defects in their babies.

question: I'm a nutritionist and 32& 3days, so ladies I wanna know do you have questions concerning your nutrition while pregnant? I can help you as much as I can, and point you in the right direction :)
title: I wanna help any women with nutrition problems!
